page.title: 10Wood carving
page.content: We interviewe{Mr Short}about this ancient art and he told us that he uses{English}woods such as{Yew, Apple, {Cherry and Ash.}He uses{yew}when he wants two colours of wood in his carving. It takes longer to do a small, intricate carving than a large, simple one. He polishes his carvings with a mixture of{bees' wax and turp- {entine.}He starts by looking at what he wants to carve for about fifteen minutes, and after sketching it on the wood he carves out what he wants with a{gouge. He uses a{Chinese}sign called a {'ying and yang'}as a trade mark.He gats most of his ideas from illustrations in books and in his twenty year occupation he has made about{600}models. He was not at all interested in carpentry as a boy. {(AUTHORS: F.Lindsay, C.Jackson)}
